item.title: Help with portfowarding plz
item.dc:creator: @pancholip pancholip
item.description:
@pancholip wrote:

he or she is talking about static ip… not port forwarding but anyway, for static ip you need to go to no-ip.com, get an account and then download the duc, enter you no ip stuff into the duc and then once you’re logged in, you make sure that you’re domain is checked and that there’s a smilie there. your new domain is your static ip

Read full topic

item.title: Help with portfowarding plz
item.dc:creator: @shadow12 shadow12
item.description:
@shadow12 wrote:

ok i was stuck with this like for onemonth so i will share how i got it working

OK first log into ur router
there should be an advanced option click and then there should be drop down box drop down and select virtual server/DMZ click then it should come up with more option like ones you have added click add for rule idea put 43594 lan ip is ur 192.168 ip then for destation port put 43594 and local put 43594 that should open the port so click ok or whatever you can then go on security and click ip filter now click add then put rule id put 43594 then click allow incoming traffic then click ok at bottom and now load no-ip and runserver and hopefully it will work post if you still have porblems

Read full topic
